The speaker then corrected themselves and apologized for their mistake, indicating that they were mistaken. Therefore, the text is verifiable and can be considered true.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: If you look at the vote of the security committee that evaluated the information from the Security Information Service, even the parties that usually don't applaud the BIS, whether it's the SPD or the Communists, they all voted for the resolution where we defined the threat as serious. 
SECTION B: I read the article in translation, or rather the interview with Mr. Vice-Chairman Filip, he was of course described in the Russian military magazine as the Vice-Chairman of the Chamber of Deputies, he was not there only as the Chairman of the Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia. He acted as one of the highest constitutional officials and that is how he spoke for that medium.
SECTION C: (...) but to question within the Russian Federation, within their media space, the role of our legionnaires in history – those who simply stood as one of the first for the freedom of Czechoslovakia, for the fact that we had the first democratic state, the so often invoked first republic – and he dares to question it (Vojtěch Filip, note: Demagog.cz).
SECTION D: I am originally a history teacher and I perceive the role of the Vlasovites as very contradictory. I realize that at the end of the war they certainly helped Prague, for example, but overall we cannot see their role as entirely positive, although history always has many interpretations. They are people who opposed Stalin, but at the same time they are people who fought on the side of the Germans.
SECTION E: That was in the draft resolution - that point was not discussed for technical reasons, it was postponed to the next meeting of the security committee - but the resolution asked whether there was any methodology and whether there should not be, and whether there should not be a binding methodology for all members of the government, specifically for the use, the secure use of email accounts, the government's own.
SECTION F: After all, in Václav Moravec's Questions, Jan Hamáček also expressed that at least that part of the resolution that I proposed and where we say that the legionnaires as such are simply those who have contributed to our state, and that should not be questioned and the Chamber of Deputies supports that, so he is ready to support that part of the resolution.
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

SUMMARY: The text states that the European Commission highly appreciated the country's plan to head towards emission-free energy, which involves increasing the share of nuclear and renewable sources in the energy mix. The text also mentions that the country has definitively announced its intention to go nuclear and has begun official negotiations on the matter. Therefore, the veracity of the text can be established as TRUE.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

According to information from the Ministry of Industry and Trade (MIT), a zoning decision on the construction of a new nuclear unit at the Dukovany Nuclear Power Plant should be issued in 2021, a supplier should be selected by the end of 2022, construction should begin in 2029, and the investment should be completed in 2036. There is a risk that in 2040, electricity supplies would not cover consumption for 678 or even up to 3,622 hours a year, and electricity consumption would therefore have to be regulated.

According to the news website Ekolist.cz, a Czech delegation discussed the construction of a new nuclear unit in Dukovany in Brussels on November 20, 2019. It was the first major meeting that precedes the European Union's approval of the completion of the planned new unit at the Dukovany Nuclear Power Plant. We asked René Neděla, Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade for Energy, who also participated in the meeting, whether the Commission had truly appreciated the Czech Republic's move towards a zero-emission economy. He confirmed these words.

The Czech Republic's State Energy Concept (.pdf, p. 44) in the field of energy and climate envisages increasing the share of nuclear energy in primary energy sources to 25–33% (from the current approximately 15%). The share in electricity production should then increase to 58% from the current approximately 34% (p. 9).

The National Action Plan (.pdf, p. 7) for the development of nuclear energy in the Czech Republic from 2015 envisages strengthening the role of nuclear power in electricity generation, namely by building 1-2 new nuclear power plant units and extending the service life of the current Dukovany NPP units.

In relation to renewable sources, the National Plan (.docx, pp. 26–27) states that " The Czech Republic plans to achieve a share of renewable energy sources in gross final consumption of 22% by 2030, which is an increase of 9 percentage points compared to the national target of 13% for 2020. The stated share of 22% corresponds to the requirement to express a national contribution to achieving the binding EU target of 32% by 2030 according to Article 3 of the revised version of Directive 2009/28/EC on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources ( Directive 2018/2001 ) ".

According to the National Plan (.docx, p. 13) of the Czech Republic in the field of energy and climate (also referred to as the climate and energy plan), the share of coal and other solid non-renewable fuels in gross electricity production in 2016 was 50%, the target level in 2040 is 11–21%.

The National Energy and Climate Plan of the Czech Republic (.docx, p. 1) corresponds to the priorities of the European Commission. It was prepared based on the requirement of Regulation (EC) No 2018/1999 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Governance of the Energy Union and Climate Action, the draft of which was presented as part of the legislative package entitled " Clean Energy for All Europeans ". The European Commission published it on 30 November 2016. The National Energy and Climate Plan of the Czech Republic is a revised version of the draft document of the same name, which was taken into account by the Czech Government on 28 January 2019 and which was submitted to the European Commission on 30 January 2019. The European Commission issued a recommendation on this original draft on 18 June 2019.

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: TRUE, SECTION A

Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: I requested from the Ministry of Finance a list of goods and services where VAT was reduced during our period. This (passenger transport, note Demagog.cz) was the only item where we did not do it (we did not vote for a VAT reduction, note Demagog.cz), because transport companies would make money from it without it being reflected in reduced fares for people.
SECTION B: He (Miloš Zeman, note: Demagog.cz) was known to Mr. Sobotka, who first went to the president with the nomination of Mr. Prouza to head the Ministry of Industry and Trade, and when he told Sobotka that he would never appoint Prouza, he came up with another name and did not even propose Prouza. It was the same with my dismissal, which he did not push through, so I resigned myself.
SECTION C: Kateřina Perknerová: But the marginal issue is certainly not the bribery affair at the Ministry of Transport, when former Minister Kremlík did not report the alleged corrupt offer of 1.5 million crowns. Andrej Babiš: He reported it. Kateřina Perknerová: He told the head of the BIS three weeks after the bribe offer. A normal person acts differently, right? Andrej Babiš: That's true.

SECTION D: And here, yes, is Article 122 (of the Treaty on the Functioning of the EU - note by Demagog.cz), former Article 100: If a Member State encounters difficulties or is seriously threatened by natural disasters or exceptional occurrences beyond its control, the Council, on a proposal from the Commission, may, under certain conditions, grant the Member State concerned financial assistance from the Union.
SECTION E: Why, at a time when no foreign power threatens us or interferes in our affairs, and we, as a state and as citizens, truly have our destiny in our own hands for the first time in centuries, do we have so few reasons for joyful satisfaction? These words were uttered exactly 28 years ago, in 1992, in the New Year's speech of the then President Václav Havel.
SECTION F: We can now talk in principle about the fact that Europe has never borrowed. Here is the Treaty on the European Community. And here Article 311 says: The Union shall provide itself with the means necessary to achieve its objectives and to successfully implement its policies. The budget is financed entirely from its own resources, other revenues are not affected.
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: On Friday (March 17, 2023, note: Demagog.cz), information appeared that was not from me, I immediately responded to it, I denied that I would not submit an amendment to this law (regulating the valorization mechanism, note: Demagog.cz) to the government either this week or next week until negotiations with social partners, with the opposition, and until I had completed the proper interdepartmental comment procedure. (...) Yesterday I also wrote this clearly under the account of the Chairwoman Alena Schillerová on Twitter.
SECTION B: So, the tools of assistance (compensation for entrepreneurs, note: Demagog.cz) are shared here today mainly by 3 ministries, that is the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs, for us it is the programs of Antivirus (...), and then we also share the tools of assistance with the Ministry of Industry and Trade and the Ministry of Finance, where the other tools of assistance for entrepreneurs and tradesmen are. 
SECTION C: In the past, there have been judgments where the Constitutional Court stated that, for example, it found some doubts about the legislative process, but did not change the substance, or said that the substance had some defects from the Constitutional Court's perspective, but gave a deadline or said how it would see the correction.
SECTION D: The mechanism (increase in pensions, note: Demagog.cz) is given by law (...), if since the last month taken for the valorization of pensions, which took place from January, which is July last year, inflation increases by more than 5% in total, then pensions are automatically valorized and are valorized according to the level of inflation in the last month in which the cumulative increase of over 5% occurred.

SECTION E: We said that with the pension reform we want to ensure, firstly, that we guarantee decent pensions for the generation of people in their forties, thirties and younger people, also in the future, that there is a fair system, that it is sustainable, that nothing fundamental will change for current pensioners and people of pre-retirement age who are 50 plus.
SECTION F: If you look at the press conference recording (after the government meeting on April 27, note: Demagog.cz), I leaned over to the Prime Minister and asked if it was pure or crude. He himself wasn't entirely sure. I said pure. (...) it was my mistake, I apologized for it, I set it straight.
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: Well, I recommended quite publicly when he was appointed (Minister of Culture Zaorálek, note: Demagog.cz) that he realize that he can have a comfortable life, going from reception to reception, from opening to opening, from festival to festival, but that the Ministry of Culture should take care of dilapidated cultural monuments.
SECTION B: So I have problems with compulsory voting. I'll ignore the stupid argument that the communists introduced it. By the way, you know, right? On the contrary, they abolished Masaryk's law on compulsory voting and formally and only formally, voting was not compulsory. But something else is that under the communists, voting was enforced quite drastically, although not by law.


 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: ...And I was with the admiral who is in charge of Operation Sofia.... We don't have the permission of the Libyan government, we don't have the permission of the UN Security Council, so the admiral is operating in that area, but he can't fight the smugglers on Libyan territory. So what is he doing? He says here that I have destroyed 551 ships and detained 151 migrants. But he will first save the ship and they are not random castaways, according to maritime law. They go there on purpose, yes. And by the way, there are still those non-profit ships waiting there that send signals: come, come, we are waiting. So they have to transport them to the port, the migrants are excited, within two hours, they have already tried it. They will say, well, that's the smuggler, he was on the ship with us. The smugglers then go to prison and then they destroy the ship. So this is really not like a systemic solution. There's a mafia here, they only trade in people and even oil and so on.

Iran and Pakistan are countries where Islam is the state religion.

The process of appointing the Director of the General Inspectorate of Security Forces (GIBS) is stated in Section 1, Paragraph 2 of the Act on the General Inspectorate of Security Forces and on Amendments to Related Acts:

“ The Inspectorate is headed by the Director of the Inspectorate (hereinafter referred to as the “Director”), who is appointed and dismissed 1) by the Prime Minister, upon a proposal from the Government and after discussion in the Committee of the Chamber of Deputies responsible for security matters, to whom the Director is accountable for the performance of his/her duties. ”

The vacant position of head of GIBS was vacated after the institution's second-in-command, Michael Murín, decided to resign from his position after disputes with Prime Minister Andrej Babiš, who also imposed disciplinary proceedings against him.

He officially justified his departure by saying that his “ remaining at the head of GIBS could give rise to unjustified questioning of the results of its work. ” 12 candidates applied for the second selection procedure for the post of new director (when the first one was closed due to only one candidate). An independent expert commission subsequently elected Radim Dragoun, the head of the District Prosecutor’s Office in Louny. The Prime Minister fully accepted the commission’s conclusions.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

The Ministry of the Interior also commented on the draft Building Act in its analysis (.pdf). In her statement, Minister Dostálová criticizes the estimates of the Ministry of the Interior, which estimated one-time costs at CZK 2.2—31.6 billion (p. 4). The part of securing space for new regional building offices and the planned Supreme Building Office is mainly criticized.

The Ministry of the Interior states in the introduction to the section on Premises (p. 32) that the draft law “(...) currently assumes an optimistic scenario where municipalities and regions will provide the state with their current premises. This expectation is unrealistic; the capacity of municipalities and regions will not be made available, as it would bring extraordinary problems in the area of IT, operation, sharing of services (e.g. the registry office) or working in a different regime (the Act on Civil Servants vs. the Civil Service Act). In the event of delimitation, it will be necessary to provide premises. ” Estimates for securing premises by renting are around CZK 425 million per year. The Ministry further notes that “ (...) it is not possible to solve the delimitation by renting everywhere, as no suitable premises are available at all in certain locations. ” (p. 33)

The chapter dedicated to Construction (pp. 33—34) then states that " The maximalist variant assumes that new premises would be built for all existing officials of building authorities, integrated affected bodies and new service personnel. This includes 13,584 employees in total. Construction expenses would reach at least 25.4 billion crowns in the maximalist variant. " (p. 34). To these costs it would be necessary to add the costs of building archives for storing documentation. These costs are around CZK 3.5 billion. In total, the Ministry of the Interior estimates the construction in the most expensive possible version at CZK 28.9 billion.

Minister Dostálová falsely stated that " (...) the analysis of the Ministry of the Interior does not state that the state currently pays municipalities for the officials who handle construction procedures" . The chapter Financing the Agenda in the analysis deals with this entire issue. (p. 36), which details the current financing of the agenda of building authorities, spatial planning and partly also the affected authorities, which are currently financed through a contribution to the performance of state administration (pursuant to Section 62 of Act No. 128/2000 Coll., on municipalities and Section 29(2) of Act No. 129/2000 Coll., on regions ).

The procedures for determining the amount of the contribution for the performance of state administration for 2020 are listed in the annex to Act No. 355/2019 on the State Budget of the Czech Republic for 2020. The individual contribution amounts for specific municipalities can also be clearly found on the website of the Ministry of the Interior.

The Ministry of the Interior further states (.pdf, p. 38) that the total real costs (including overheads) for the agenda of building authorities and land planning authorities at the municipal and regional levels amount to almost 4.6 billion CZK, of which 4.2 billion CZK are spent on municipalities. However, in reality, only 2.3 billion CZK is spent on the state budget through contributions to municipalities and regions. According to the Ministry of the Interior, the real overhead costs amount to 1.1 billion CZK.

Although the probability of constructing new buildings for all planned employees of new building authorities is unknown, we assess the statement as false, because the analysis of the Ministry of the Interior also addresses the issue of financing building authorities through contributions for the performance of state administration, the amount of which differs from those mentioned in Minister Dostálová's statement.

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

The Chamber of Deputies' proposals for granting or awarding state decorations, specifically the nomination for the decoration of Karel Sýs, were voted on May 25, 2018. 14 Pirate deputies voted in favor. However, the Pirates later apologized for voting for the state decoration for Karel Sýs. Deputy Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies Vojtěch Pikal, who admitted his mistake in an interview with iRozhlas.cz, said the following :

" I made the mistake of not studying the personalities enough. I relied on the words of the other deputies from the subcommittee. I thought I would have more time to prepare that day. I did not know that I would be presiding over the Chamber and standing in for Speaker Vondráček (Radek Vondráček from ANO), who suddenly lost his voice."

While Pikal apologizes for not having studied the personalities well enough, Chairman Bartoš talks about the item being put forward and the vote being taken by mistake. According to the shorthand report, the vote was as follows:

PSP Deputy Chairman Vojtěch Pikal: The next proposal is Karel Sýs.
PSP Deputy Chairman Vojtěch Filip: I have started voting number 96 and I am asking who is in favor. Who is against? Thank you.
Voting number 96. Of the 161 deputies present, 108 voted in favor, 25 against. The proposal was adopted.

Pirates chairman Ivan Bartoš commented on the vote for Karel Sýs in an interview as follows :

" Nominations for the award were supposed to be discussed only at the end of the second week, but they were put forward. We had not gone through them. About three names were voted on in the plenary session within one minute, some Pirate MPs noticed the problematic Mr. Sýs and abstained from voting, some followed Vojta Pikal's recommendation."

On October 25, 2018, a vote was also taken on a proposal to permanently include item 117 regarding state awards on the same day, and this proposal was adopted . The shortened period before the vote may therefore have had an impact on its outcome, although we cannot verify whether the Pirates voted "by mistake".

The nomination required 81 MPs to vote in favor. The proposal to nominate Karel Sýs for the state award was approved, with a total of 108 MPs voting in favor, including 14 MPs from the Pirate Party. So even if the Pirate Party MPs had not voted in favor of the proposal, it would still have passed.

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: TRUE, SECTION A.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: EDITOR: ODS, TOP 09, STAN and the People's Party proposed rejecting measures that would burden people financially, whether it was doubling the land registry fee, taxing insurance company reserves, or maintaining a four percent tax on real estate transfers. You pushed through better conditions for home brewing and poker players. Isn't that a bit much? BARTOŠ: Their proposals didn't pass, ours did.
SECTION B: I talked about the need to hire a dedicated person to set up communication processes and identify burnout among some politicians. I proposed a budget amendment so that we could pay for such an expert. I promised on our online forum that I would come up with some concrete proposal by Christmas. 
SECTION C: Even in the 2017 pre-election strategy, and in the next one, it is clearly defined. We said that we will not go with undemocratic parties or support a government that will use their votes. So at the moment it is SPD or KSČM. And then we set clear conditions and those conditions of cooperation were there. It will not be a government that will have a majority of YES. There will be no people who have a corrupt past or are in a conflict of interest.
SECTION D: It was the first thing that the government, still a minority government of Andrej Babiš without confidence, started to address, the civil service law. And unfortunately, the proposal that then seemed to fall out of their hands, was so opposed by the European Commission that the original idea of the law, which would cut off the influence of the executive branch and politicians, ministers on the operation of state administration, would lead to so-called depoliticization, and that is what is being disrupted by these measures. 
SECTION E: Editor: And Mr. Chairman, do you think that you are already an adult party and that what commentators often say about you, that you are toddlers with a flamethrower, because you burn everything out of the opposition, but you are unable to come to an agreement with anyone, no longer applies to you? Bartoš: That was a famous statement by Mr. Jindřich Šídl, I saw it when someone repeated it in your editorial office in a comment on the forum.
SECTION F: I was happy, for example, that I could support another year of the Romea scholarship awards for Roma students of secondary and higher vocational schools with Olga Richterová. It is a great project, but unfortunately there is a double excess of applicants who should receive the scholarship. It is not high, but the 14 thousand is a lot for their families.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: Look at how we are increasing pensions. Here we are, the coalition government, we haven't had time yet. And here we are, 2018, 475 crowns and this is the proposal of the minority government of the ANO movement. That, my government, which ruled brilliantly for 205 days, without confidence, but it worked perfectly, is increasing 918 crowns on average per month and another 1,000 crowns for pensioners aged 85. 
SECTION B: ...and I discussed it with him (Wolfgang Schäuble - note: Demagogue) and he always understood us, he saw it at the press conference and said yes, here is the Czech Republic, and the V4 have a different history, they don't have the multicultural model and we don't want it, because the foreigners haven't been integrated in the individual states. 
SECTION C: And I would like to show the audience that I made a contract with them here before the elections, in October 2017, and I am fulfilling those points. I pledged that we would never allow illegal migrants into our territory and that we would never agree to the distribution of migrants according to mandatory quotas. I fulfilled that in six months, we enforced that, yes.
SECTION D: The result is that the chairman of the creditors' committee, the administrator, Mr. Monsport and representatives of the cooperative were also there, so a timetable was agreed upon and that both parties would try to find a new expert who would take into account the investment in time of the people who actually live in those housing units.
SECTION E: And then there is Libya. That is the biggest problem. There is not actually one government there, there are elections coming up, the Libyan guard, which we helped as part of Operation Sofia, is very effective. It is holding the ships, 84% and they didn't have oil in August. So Prime Minister Conte was dealing with oil, because it is a state-owned company, but the government was not able to force them to give the Libyan guard oil so that they could hold the ships.
SECTION F: ...And I was with the admiral who is in charge of Operation Sofia.... We don't have the permission of the Libyan government, we don't have the permission of the UN Security Council, so the admiral is operating in that area, but he can't fight the smugglers on Libyan territory. So what is he doing? He says here that I have destroyed 551 ships and detained 151 migrants. But he will first save the ship and they are not random castaways, according to maritime law. They go there on purpose, yes. And by the way, there are still those non-profit ships waiting there that send signals: come, come, we are waiting. So they have to transport them to the port, the migrants are excited, within two hours, they have already tried it. They will say, well, that's the smuggler, he was on the ship with us. Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: EDITOR: But you had a campaign based on a bus, in which you had pictures of various politicians. IVAN BARTOŠ: There was a funny bus, so everyone was in civilian clothes, there were caricatures and people from the Social Democrats were sitting there. People who were in the government for the KDU-ČSL and then for TOP 09, for example, were sitting there.
SECTION B: So I'll just briefly talk about Lukáš Wagenknecht. Andrej Babiš brought him to finance as a top analyst who fights corruption. And Lukáš Wagenknecht started doing his job, and of course Mr. Babiš didn't like that, so he fired him, he rejected him. Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected for the Pirates in the last election period in the last Senate elections,
SECTION C: I talked about the need to hire a dedicated person to set up communication processes and identify burnout among some politicians. I proposed a budget amendment so that we could pay for such an expert. I promised on our online forum that I would come up with some concrete proposal by Christmas. 
SECTION D: Even in the 2017 pre-election strategy, and in the next one, it is clearly defined. We said that we will not go with undemocratic parties or support a government that will use their votes. So at the moment it is SPD or KSČM. And then we set clear conditions and those conditions of cooperation were there. It will not be a government that will have a majority of YES. There will be no people who have a corrupt past or are in a conflict of interest.
SECTION E: Editor: And Mr. Chairman, do you think that you are already an adult party and that what commentators often say about you, that you are toddlers with a flamethrower, because you burn everything out of the opposition, but you are unable to come to an agreement with anyone, no longer applies to you? Bartoš: That was a famous statement by Mr. Jindřich Šídl, I saw it when someone repeated it in your editorial office in a comment on the forum.
SECTION F: He is on the election committee (Lukáš Wagenknecht, note: Demagog.cz), which elected him himself. There are a lot of people on the election committee. People from the media department, our politicians, regional campaign coordinators, and Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected there as the head who deals with the preparation of the campaign, its financing and coordination.
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: In the context provided, the answer to the question is "in a situation where there is a threat of drought, the spruce tree, which is typically an ideal tree for a milder climate with some precipitation and cold winters, is an ideal tree."

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question: Please answer TRUE, FALSE or UNKNOWABLE about the text's veracity. In addition write a short summary explaining your answer. If the veracity cannot be determined answer UNKNOWABLE. The first sentence in the response should be TRUE. FALSE. or UNKNOWABLE. eg:UNKNOWABLE.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer:
TRUE.

The text states that many experts agree that the spruce tree is ideal for a more humid climate with milder precipitation and cold winters. This is a factual statement that can be verified through research and is widely accepted by experts in the field, therefore it is TRUE.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

Simply put, Brabec says in his statement that according to experts, spruce thrives in a wetter climate than a drier one, and that all experts claim this today. This corresponds to our research in the professional literature. We have reviewed several studies, in which, for example, the following formulations are found:

" Wiping and dying are affecting spruce stands of all ages, both artificially established and naturally regenerated. The mechanism of damage is not described in detail, but its basic cause is fluctuations in meteorological conditions, which can be linked to ongoing global climate change. The triggering mechanism of catastrophic damage is recurring periods of drought. " (V. Šrámek and K. Neudertová Hellebrandová, VULHM, p. 305, here )

" Spring and summer drought episodes are demonstrably not only a factor limiting plant growth, but also a significant predisposing stressor. Drought increases sensitivity to some biotic diseases (in particular, a higher incidence of vascular mycoses and diseases of the assimilation apparatus can be expected) and also increases the threat from insect pests. " (P. Čermák, VULHM, p. 9, here )

" The most vulnerable point in the stability of spruce stands growing in the Czech Republic in lower forest vegetation stages (in the 5th to 3rd LVS) is the disruption of its moisture balance with a direct impact on the soil moisture regime and water reserves in the soil. " (P. Hadaš, LDF MZLU, here ).

In the studies we searched for, it is repeatedly stated that drought is a threatening factor for the growth of spruce trees. It is not in our power to determine whether all experts claim this, as Brabec says. However, the fact is that we were unable to find a study that would claim the opposite.

SECTION B:

The Czech government actually rejected the Russian accusation, as Brabec claims, and the Russian ambassador was indeed invited to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. We assess the statement as true despite Brabec's inaccuracy that Minister Stropnický himself negotiated with the Russian ambassador. In reality, it was his deputy Šrámek.

The government opposed the Russian accusation in a statement issued after Prime Minister Babiš's meeting with the directors of the BIS and Military Intelligence. It states, among other things, that:

"No Novichok-type substance has ever been produced, developed or stored in the Czech Republic. This was stated unanimously by both intelligence services in their reports. In the Czech Republic, a program for the protection of troops and the population and the detection of weapons of mass destruction was launched in 2017. As part of this program, the Novichok A-230 substance was to be tested.

In the first phase, the microsynthesis of the substance Novichok A-230 was carried out. During the microsynthesis, the substance was not isolated and this procedure is not considered production or development according to the methodology of the State Office for Nuclear Safety. The resulting product was immediately destroyed. The second phase of the program was not started. The substance of the Novichok A-230 type is different from the substance A-234, which was used in the poisoning of Sergei Skripal in the United Kingdom. The two substances are completely different and have a clearly different chemical structure.

Subsequently, as Brabec claims, the Russian ambassador was indeed invited. The Russian ambassador was informed of the Czech Republic's reservations regarding Russia's accusation of producing Novichok (video from 4:57). However, the meeting with the Russian ambassador was not attended by Minister Stropnický, but by his deputy Šrámek (video from 00:10).

SECTION C:

On 17 December 2018, the government approved a draft law amending Act No. 248/2000 Coll., on the support of regional development, as amended. The draft law was submitted by the Minister for Regional Development Klára Dostálová. Specifically, it is intended to amend Section 18(8) of Act No. 248/2000 Coll., which currently reads as follows: “ The Council for the European Structural and Investment Funds (hereinafter referred to as the “Council”) is hereby established, which is an advisory body to the Government. The Chairman of the Council is the Prime Minister. Its members are representatives of central state administration bodies and representatives of advisory and working bodies of the Government. Details regarding the composition, powers, organization and activities of the Council shall be determined by its statute, which shall be approved by the Government. ”

The proposed amendment (.docx) states: " In Section 18, paragraph 8, second sentence, of Act No. 248/2000 Coll., on the support of regional development, as amended by Act No. 298/2015 Coll. and Act No. 367/2017 Coll., the word ' chairman' is replaced by the word 'member' . "

The amendment's submission report (.docx) also states that, until the amendment enters into force, the Council's Statute will entrust its presidency to the Executive Vice-Chairman of the Council, i.e. the Minister for Regional Development.

The current competences of the Council are defined by the Statute of the Council (.pdf), adopted by the government resolution of 27 April 2016. According to this document, the Council is an advisory body to the government regarding the coordination of assistance provided from the European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF). According to Article 2, point 2. part c), the Council "discusses the substantive interface and connections between programmes co-financed by the ESI Funds with a focus on ensuring synergistic effects".

Or , in the words of Minister Brabec, is this body really " recommends systemic solutions to the government, for example in terms of drawing down European funds, or is responsible for the implementation and the relationship between individual programs and the drawing down of funds for individual program objectives. "

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: TRUE, SECTION B

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

The statement is assessed as true because both interested parties, according to their public statements, have indeed agreed on the aforementioned steps.

The result of another meeting, which was attended by Prime Minister Andrej Babiš, among others, was a promise that none of the H-System clients would be evicted from Horoměřice until the case was resolved. Representatives of the Svatopluk association agreed with the bankruptcy administrator Josef Monsport that they would not apply the Supreme Court's decision for the time being, according to which H-System clients were to move out of their homes in Horoměřice within thirty days.

The main success was the agreement to prepare a new expert opinion that will determine the value of the properties. According to the bankruptcy trustee, they are worth about 140 million, according to their residents, ten and a half million. Until the opinion is prepared and evaluated, no one will move. The creditors' committee will decide on August 30 who will prepare the opinion. " Milestone number two will be an agreement on the method of assignment, milestone number three will be an evaluation on both sides, " said the cooperative's legal representative, Svatopluk Lubomír Kincl. " The opinion should look for what the usual price of the properties is in 2018, but also what it was on several previous dates, " said Josef Monsport.

In 1993, the H-System company concluded contracts with hundreds of interested parties for the construction and transfer of apartments and houses. In the autumn of 1997, it went bankrupt, having completed only 34 family houses. Thousands of people lost about a billion after the collapse of H-System. The Svatopluk housing cooperative was founded by some of the damaged clients in October 1997 with the aim of continuing construction even at the cost of additional investments. The then bankruptcy administrator Karel Kudláček allowed them to do so under certain conditions. However, his successor Monsport later called on them to vacate the properties and enable the sale, with all the clients of the bankrupt company to be satisfied from the proceeds. The members of the cooperative have been in dispute with Monsport since 2000 so that they would not have to move out.

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: We can now talk in principle about the fact that Europe has never borrowed. Here is the Treaty on the European Community. And here Article 311 says: The Union shall provide itself with the means necessary to achieve its objectives and to successfully implement its policies. The budget is financed entirely from its own resources, other revenues are not affected.
SECTION B: I requested from the Ministry of Finance a list of goods and services where VAT was reduced during our period. This (passenger transport, note Demagog.cz) was the only item where we did not do it (we did not vote for a VAT reduction, note Demagog.cz), because transport companies would make money from it without it being reflected in reduced fares for people.
SECTION C: He (Miloš Zeman, note: Demagog.cz) was known to Mr. Sobotka, who first went to the president with the nomination of Mr. Prouza to head the Ministry of Industry and Trade, and when he told Sobotka that he would never appoint Prouza, he came up with another name and did not even propose Prouza. It was the same with my dismissal, which he did not push through, so I resigned myself.
SECTION D: Kateřina Perknerová: But the marginal issue is certainly not the bribery affair at the Ministry of Transport, when former Minister Kremlík did not report the alleged corrupt offer of 1.5 million crowns. Andrej Babiš: He reported it. Kateřina Perknerová: He told the head of the BIS three weeks after the bribe offer. A normal person acts differently, right? Andrej Babiš: That's true.

SECTION E: Why, at a time when no foreign power threatens us or interferes in our affairs, and we, as a state and as citizens, truly have our destiny in our own hands for the first time in centuries, do we have so few reasons for joyful satisfaction? These words were uttered exactly 28 years ago, in 1992, in the New Year's speech of the then President Václav Havel.
SECTION F: On April 24, a petition demanding Stanek's dismissal was created, and on April 28, the vice-chairman of the ČSSD Onderka began demanding the dismissal of his own minister, contrary to the position of his own chairman. On May 2, I received the petition signatories at the Government Office, and Mr. Hamáček, who stood up for Stanek, was also at the meeting with them.

 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: We are now also participating in the parliamentary anti-corruption group, where there are representatives of all parties, where the legislation is discussed so that there is a consensus. So the so-called "Three Consensus" version has now been negotiated, which will actually allow that if an investigation of the type "I take the Rath case" is underway, journalists would not even be able to write about the fact that this case is ongoing.
SECTION B: TAKÁČ: The proposal says that the law on the obligation to provide information does not apply to ongoing criminal proceedings, with the exception of court decisions, so everyone will have access to the judgments. BARTOŠ: Well, but only at the very end of the whole case, so when there is a court proceeding, you would basically have a total embargo on all information until the decision.
SECTION C: If we look at the records from the Chamber of Deputies, actually this whole one (the draft amendment to the Civil Service Act, note: Demagog.cz), why is it necessary to do it so conveniently for the government, Mr. Babiš and the Minister of Health argued that they have someone there who they can't seem to get rid of, which is simply not true.
SECTION D: We managed to fix a few things there. The fundamental reservations that the European Commission had about the proposal, that the period for which you have the remedy is being shortened, that the scale of the assessment is actually being expanded, so that you can actually fire the person if they get a five or a four. We tried to fix that with the help of amendments, and that seemed to be successful. However, Minister Dostálová included the amendment that actually allows getting rid of those state secretaries by decision of the government, on the recommendation of the minister.
SECTION E: It was the first thing that the government, still a minority government of Andrej Babiš without confidence, started to address, the civil service law. And unfortunately, the proposal that then seemed to fall out of their hands, was so opposed by the European Commission that the original idea of the law, which would cut off the influence of the executive branch and politicians, ministers on the operation of state administration, would lead to so-called depoliticization, and that is what is being disrupted by these measures. 
SECTION F: BARTOŠ: (...) in the media power that the (...) prime minister has thanks to his position as owner of the largest media house in the Czech Republic. TAKÁČ: The media house is in a trust fund, it is not owned by Andrej Babiš. BARTOŠ: Well, I have my favorite graphic here, yes, how Mr. Babiš is the founder, the benefactor and owns both funds (...).
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: Even in the 2017 pre-election strategy, and in the next one, it is clearly defined. We said that we will not go with undemocratic parties or support a government that will use their votes. So at the moment it is SPD or KSČM. And then we set clear conditions and those conditions of cooperation were there. It will not be a government that will have a majority of YES. There will be no people who have a corrupt past or are in a conflict of interest.
SECTION B: EDITOR: He stayed (Jakub Michálek, note: Demagog.cz), but he no longer wanted to run for first vice-chairman. IVAN BARTOŠ: Yes, he did. He announced that sometime in the middle of last year. After all, the focus of his work lies in the parliamentary club, where the chairman of the parliamentary club was elected last week and Jakub Michálek defended him.
SECTION C: Editor: And Mr. Chairman, do you think that you are already an adult party and that what commentators often say about you, that you are toddlers with a flamethrower, because you burn everything out of the opposition, but you are unable to come to an agreement with anyone, no longer applies to you? Bartoš: That was a famous statement by Mr. Jindřich Šídl, I saw it when someone repeated it in your editorial office in a comment on the forum.
SECTION D: He is on the election committee (Lukáš Wagenknecht, note: Demagog.cz), which elected him himself. There are a lot of people on the election committee. People from the media department, our politicians, regional campaign coordinators, and Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected there as the head who deals with the preparation of the campaign, its financing and coordination.

People who were in the government for the KDU-ČSL and then for TOP 09, for example, were sitting there.
SECTION F: So I'll just briefly talk about Lukáš Wagenknecht. Andrej Babiš brought him to finance as a top analyst who fights corruption. demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

On 17 December 2018, the government approved a draft law amending Act No. 248/2000 Coll., on the support of regional development, as amended. The draft law was submitted by the Minister for Regional Development Klára Dostálová. Specifically, it is intended to amend Section 18(8) of Act No. 248/2000 Coll., which currently reads as follows: “ The Council for the European Structural and Investment Funds (hereinafter referred to as the “Council”) is hereby established, which is an advisory body to the Government. The Chairman of the Council is the Prime Minister. Its members are representatives of central state administration bodies and representatives of advisory and working bodies of the Government. Details regarding the composition, powers, organization and activities of the Council shall be determined by its statute, which shall be approved by the Government. ”

The proposed amendment (.docx) states: " In Section 18, paragraph 8, second sentence, of Act No. 248/2000 Coll., on the support of regional development, as amended by Act No. 298/2015 Coll. and Act No. 367/2017 Coll., the word ' chairman' is replaced by the word 'member' . "

The amendment's submission report (.docx) also states that, until the amendment enters into force, the Council's Statute will entrust its presidency to the Executive Vice-Chairman of the Council, i.e. the Minister for Regional Development.

The current competences of the Council are defined by the Statute of the Council (.pdf), adopted by the government resolution of 27 April 2016. According to this document, the Council is an advisory body to the government regarding the coordination of assistance provided from the European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF). According to Article 2, point 2. part c), the Council "discusses the substantive interface and connections between programmes co-financed by the ESI Funds with a focus on ensuring synergistic effects".

Or , in the words of Minister Brabec, is this body really " recommends systemic solutions to the government, for example in terms of drawing down European funds, or is responsible for the implementation and the relationship between individual programs and the drawing down of funds for individual program objectives. "

SECTION B:

The Czech government actually rejected the Russian accusation, as Brabec claims, and the Russian ambassador was indeed invited to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. We assess the statement as true despite Brabec's inaccuracy that Minister Stropnický himself negotiated with the Russian ambassador. In reality, it was his deputy Šrámek.

The government opposed the Russian accusation in a statement issued after Prime Minister Babiš's meeting with the directors of the BIS and Military Intelligence. It states, among other things, that:

"No Novichok-type substance has ever been produced, developed or stored in the Czech Republic. This was stated unanimously by both intelligence services in their reports. In the Czech Republic, a program for the protection of troops and the population and the detection of weapons of mass destruction was launched in 2017. As part of this program, the Novichok A-230 substance was to be tested.

In the first phase, the microsynthesis of the substance Novichok A-230 was carried out. During the microsynthesis, the substance was not isolated and this procedure is not considered production or development according to the methodology of the State Office for Nuclear Safety. The resulting product was immediately destroyed. The second phase of the program was not started. The substance of the Novichok A-230 type is different from the substance A-234, which was used in the poisoning of Sergei Skripal in the United Kingdom. The two substances are completely different and have a clearly different chemical structure.

Subsequently, as Brabec claims, the Russian ambassador was indeed invited. The Russian ambassador was informed of the Czech Republic's reservations regarding Russia's accusation of producing Novichok (video from 4:57). However, the meeting with the Russian ambassador was not attended by Minister Stropnický, but by his deputy Šrámek (video from 00:10).

Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
demagog-statements-public/statement_only.answer: TRUE, SECTION A

demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.question: What are the potential benefits and challenges of abolishing all tax exemptions in a country?
demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.answer: The potential benefits of abolishing all tax exemptions in a country include increased government revenue, which could be used to fund public policies and infrastructure projects. It could also lead to a more simplified tax system and reduce the potential for tax evasion. However, there are also potential challenges, such as the impact on businesses and individuals who rely on tax exemptions, as well as the potential for increased costs to the government in terms of administering the tax system.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.question: How might the methodology used to calculate tax reliefs influence economic policy decisions?
demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.answer: The methodology used to calculate tax reliefs can significantly influence economic policy decisions as it can affect the amount of tax reliefs available and the allocation of resources.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.question: What are the implications of using diverse methodologies for calculating tax reliefs on fiscal transparency?
demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.answer: The answer is:Fiscal transparency.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.question: In what ways can the implementation of tax relief reforms impact a country's economic health and social equity?
demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.answer: The implementation of tax relief reforms can impact a country's economic health and social equity in various ways. On the one hand, tax reliefs can promote economic growth by reducing the tax burden on individuals and businesses, which can lead to increased investment, consumption, and job creation. This can have a positive impact on the overall economy and contribute to economic growth. On the other hand, tax reliefs can also lead to a reduction in government revenue, which can negatively impact the government's ability to fund public goods and services, potentially leading to a decrease in social equity. Additionally, tax reliefs can also exacerbate income inequality by disproportionately benefiting higher-income individuals and businesses. Therefore, the implementation of tax relief reforms must be carefully considered to ensure that they do not have an adverse impact on a country's economic health and social equity.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21452/ques.question: How does the variation in estimates for tax reliefs influence public debates on fiscal policy?

We don't have the permission of the Libyan government, we don't have the permission of the UN Security Council, so the admiral is operating in that area, but he can't fight the smugglers on Libyan territory. So what is he doing? He says here that I have destroyed 551 ships and detained 151 migrants. But he will first save the ship and they are not random castaways, according to maritime law. They go there on purpose, yes. And by the way, there are still those non-profit ships waiting there that send signals: come, come, we are waiting. So they have to transport them to the port, the migrants are excited, within two hours, they have already tried it. They will say, well, that's the smuggler, he was on the ship with us. The smugglers then go to prison and then they destroy the ship. So this is really not like a systemic solution. There's a mafia here, they only trade in people and even oil and so on.
SECTION E: Look at how we are increasing pensions. Here we are, the coalition government, we haven't had time yet. And here we are, 2018, 475 crowns and this is the proposal of the minority government of the ANO movement. That, my government, which ruled brilliantly for 205 days, without confidence, but it worked perfectly, is increasing 918 crowns on average per month and another 1,000 crowns for pensioners aged 85. 
SECTION F: And I would like to show the audience that I made a contract with them here before the elections, in October 2017, and I am fulfilling those points. I pledged that we would never allow illegal migrants into our territory and that we would never agree to the distribution of migrants according to mandatory quotas. I fulfilled that in six months, we enforced that, yes.

SECTION A: TAKÁČ: The proposal says that the law on the obligation to provide information does not apply to ongoing criminal proceedings, with the exception of court decisions, so everyone will have access to the judgments. You pushed through better conditions for home brewing and poker players. Isn't that a bit much? BARTOŠ: Their proposals didn't pass, ours did.
SECTION F: It was the first thing that the government, still a minority government of Andrej Babiš without confidence, started to address, the civil service law. And unfortunately, the proposal that then seemed to fall out of their hands, was so opposed by the European Commission that the original idea of the law, which would cut off the influence of the executive branch and politicians, ministers on the operation of state administration, would lead to so-called depoliticization, and that is what is being disrupted by these measures.

SECTION A: I have already initiated the re-establishment of the Disability Intergroup, which is a group for people with disabilities. I have obtained the signatures of several dozen colleagues from all factions. All committees are represented there. We have already had two meetings where we agreed on the basic parameters. The group should be established at the beginning of next year. And it is currently cooperating very closely with the European Commission and other organizations that deal with this issue.
SECTION B: The faction supported the proposal of the ANO delegation for a special vote on the individual articles that were controversial. They supported that we would express support for this separate vote, but there was a lot of talk from the majority of the faction, from members who discussed that we are a faction that is based on values, on democracy, on respect for the rule of law, and that therefore the majority intends, regardless of the outcome of the vote on those articles, to vote for the resolution.
SECTION C: For example, when parental leave was increasing, I pointed out during the negotiations that this very directive that we were talking about, the reconciliation of family and work life, was approaching us, and that there would be a big change in maternity leave. And that it would be necessary to talk about a systemic change and work it into it. Well, I was not heard from either side, so we have now increased the parental allowance in one go.
SECTION D: From the indications that I have read, it is evident that there were signals even before Mr. Švachula's arrest. Of course, things are different now that the police have gotten involved, but it has been a year and a quarter since the police actually started investigating, and only now, sometime in February, if I remember correctly, was the dissolution or expulsion of the three organizations discussed. 
SECTION E: Spěváčková: And the amount of 80 thousand (increase in parental allowance, Demagog.cz) is also okay for you? Maxová: It was in the coalition agreement. Spěváčková: There were big disputes about that, how to actually increase it. Maxová: There were disputes about how it would actually be calculated, who would get it, whether it would be divided into two amounts, twice 40 thousand or a one-time amount. I advocated a one-time amount.
SECTION F: It follows from Mr. Vokřál's latest interviews that he also wanted to dissolve after the 3 organizations were not actually dissolved, so he wanted to dissolve the whole of Brno, then I don't know what happened in the leadership that they didn't actually dissolve the 3 organizations, the resolution was revoked and it's not that Mr. Andrej Babiš said he would dissolve it, but Petr Vokřál... proposed it and of course it happened.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

Minister of Industry and Trade Karel Havlíček is talking about negotiations with the European Union regarding the completion of a new nuclear unit at the Dukovany nuclear power plant. The Ministry of Industry and Trade has previously stated that the supplier should be selected by the end of 2022. The entire construction should therefore begin in 2029 at the latest, so that the new nuclear unit can be completed by 2036.

Prime Minister Andrej Babiš said at the time that the construction was related to current events in Europe, both the fight against climate change and the reduction of emissions.

"If we look at what Europe looks like today, France is in first place, with 52 nuclear reactors, a nuclear share of 75 percent and a leader in the initiative to reduce CO2 emissions to zero by 2050. Sweden has ten nuclear units and they also have hydropower resources. Unfortunately, we only have 30 percent at the moment and our goal is to have a nuclear share of 40 percent in 2040," said Prime Minister Babiš . At the same time, he has emphasized in the past that the completion of the units must begin, even if it leads to a violation of European law.

Minister Havlíček further stated that the Czech Republic is negotiating the construction with the European Union with regard to the safety of the new facility and that it is also initiating the notification process with the European Commission, i.e. a certain authorization from the European Commission. As stated in the interview, these negotiations began on November 20, 2019. In addition to the Czech energy mix, the Czech delegation also presented a vision for renewable sources in the Czech Republic, which should lead to a so-called zero-emission economy .

We asked about the course of these negotiations to the Deputy for the Energy Section at the Ministry of Industry and Trade, Ing. et Ing. René Neděla, who also attended the negotiations. Since Deputy Neděla confirmed to us that the statements mentioned by Minister Havlíček actually occurred on the part of the Commission, we assess the statement as true.

SECTION B:

According to information from the Ministry of Industry and Trade (MIT), a zoning decision on the construction of a new nuclear unit at the Dukovany Nuclear Power Plant should be issued in 2021, a supplier should be selected by the end of 2022, construction should begin in 2029, and the investment should be completed in 2036. There is a risk that in 2040, electricity supplies would not cover consumption for 678 or even up to 3,622 hours a year, and electricity consumption would therefore have to be regulated.

According to the news website Ekolist.cz, a Czech delegation discussed the construction of a new nuclear unit in Dukovany in Brussels on November 20, 2019. It was the first major meeting that precedes the European Union's approval of the completion of the planned new unit at the Dukovany Nuclear Power Plant. We asked René Neděla, Deputy Minister of Industry and Trade for Energy, who also participated in the meeting, whether the Commission had truly appreciated the Czech Republic's move towards a zero-emission economy. He confirmed these words.

The Czech Republic's State Energy Concept (.pdf, p. 44) in the field of energy and climate envisages increasing the share of nuclear energy in primary energy sources to 25–33% (from the current approximately 15%). The share in electricity production should then increase to 58% from the current approximately 34% (p. 9).

The National Action Plan (.pdf, p. 7) for the development of nuclear energy in the Czech Republic from 2015 envisages strengthening the role of nuclear power in electricity generation, namely by building 1-2 new nuclear power plant units and extending the service life of the current Dukovany NPP units.

In relation to renewable sources, the National Plan (.docx, pp. 26–27) states that " The Czech Republic plans to achieve a share of renewable energy sources in gross final consumption of 22% by 2030, which is an increase of 9 percentage points compared to the national target of 13% for 2020. The stated share of 22% corresponds to the requirement to express a national contribution to achieving the binding EU target of 32% by 2030 according to Article 3 of the revised version of Directive 2009/28/EC on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources ( Directive 2018/2001 ) ".

According to the National Plan (.docx, p. 13) of the Czech Republic in the field of energy and climate (also referred to as the climate and energy plan), the share of coal and other solid non-renewable fuels in gross electricity production in 2016 was 50%, the target level in 2040 is 11–21%.

The National Energy and Climate Plan of the Czech Republic (.docx, p. 1) corresponds to the priorities of the European Commission. It was prepared based on the requirement of Regulation (EC) No 2018/1999 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Governance of the Energy Union and Climate Action, the draft of which was presented as part of the legislative package entitled " Clean Energy for All Europeans ". The European Commission published it on 30 November 2016. The National Energy and Climate Plan of the Czech Republic is a revised version of the draft document of the same name, which was taken into account by the Czech Government on 28 January 2019 and which was submitted to the European Commission on 30 January 2019. The European Commission issued a recommendation on this original draft on 18 June 2019.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21793/ques.question: What challenges arise when integrating non-grammatical or multi-word expressions into syntactic parsing, and how do models address these issues?
demagog-statements-public/s_id21793/ques.answer:
Integrating non-grammatical or multi-word expressions into syntactic parsing poses challenges due to their complex structure and potential ambiguity. Models address these issues by using various techniques, such as:

1. Dependency parsing: This approach focuses on identifying the syntactic dependencies between words in a sentence, including multi-word expressions. Dependency parsers can handle complex structures by breaking them down into smaller components.
2. Constituent parsing: This method involves grouping words into constituents based on their syntactic relationship. Constituent parsers can handle multi-word expressions by analyzing their internal structure and identifying the individual words that make up the expression.
3. Machine learning models: Machine learning models, such as neural networks, can be trained on labeled datasets to learn how to handle non-grammatical or multi-word expressions in syntactic parsing. These models can capture complex patterns and relationships in language.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21793/ques.answer:
The key stages involved in the development of a human embryo from fertilization to birth are as follows:

1.Fertilization:The sperm fertilizes the egg in the fallopian tube, resulting in the formation of a zygote.

2.Implantation:The zygote travels down the fallopian tube and implants itself in the lining of the uterus.

3.Embryo formation:The zygote begins to divide and develop into an embryo, which consists of three layers of cells: the ectoderm, mesoderm, and endoderm.

demagog-statements-public/explanation_on.question:
Determine whether the statement relevant to the given summary is TRUE or FALSE based on a summary and a number of statements. Only one of the following statements is relevant to the summary:
SECTION A: EDITOR: He stayed (Jakub Michálek, note: Demagog.cz), but he no longer wanted to run for first vice-chairman. IVAN BARTOŠ: Yes, he did. He announced that sometime in the middle of last year. After all, the focus of his work lies in the parliamentary club, where the chairman of the parliamentary club was elected last week and Jakub Michálek defended him.
SECTION B: He is on the election committee (Lukáš Wagenknecht, note: Demagog.cz), which elected him himself. There are a lot of people on the election committee. People from the media department, our politicians, regional campaign coordinators, and Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected there as the head who deals with the preparation of the campaign, its financing and coordination.
SECTION C: EDITOR: But you had a campaign based on a bus, in which you had pictures of various politicians. IVAN BARTOŠ: There was a funny bus, so everyone was in civilian clothes, there were caricatures and people from the Social Democrats were sitting there. People who were in the government for the KDU-ČSL and then for TOP 09, for example, were sitting there.
SECTION D: So I'll just briefly talk about Lukáš Wagenknecht. Andrej Babiš brought him to finance as a top analyst who fights corruption. And Lukáš Wagenknecht started doing his job, and of course Mr. Babiš didn't like that, so he fired him, he rejected him. Lukáš Wagenknecht was elected for the Pirates in the last election period in the last Senate elections,
SECTION E: The Central Crisis Staff, which is also required by law, was not created at the very beginning. In fact, the government retained a kind of preferential right to announce its decisions to people, politicians, and companies through press conferences, and only then was the Central Crisis Staff created, which was supposed to be a body consisting of experts, which provides the government with the documents, and based on them, the government takes individual measures.
SECTION F: I found something here that you wrote when the case started. Vojtěch Filip, I quote: "Some so-called" - I don't understand why so-called - "municipal politicians have the audacity to do without a mandate from the voters" - which they have - "even foreign policy and go against the government of the Czech Republic. When they get into trouble because of it," - so you admit here that they are in trouble - "they beg for the Czech Police to protect them with taxpayers' money. Their police officers are suddenly not enough for them." You wrote that in response on Twitter.
 Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21244/ques.answer: The statement emphasizes the importance of national unity despite political differences by highlighting that all citizens of the Czech Republic want to live together as neighbors, friends, and colleagues, regardless of their political preferences.

demagog-statements-public/s_id21244/ques.question: How does Petr Fiala justify governing for everyone, including those who did not vote for the current government?

SUMMARY: The text describes a meeting between Václav MORAVEC and Richard BRABEC where they discuss the accusations made by Russia against the Czech government. The text suggests that the Czech government rejected these accusations and invited the Russian ambassador to a meeting to make this clear. Based on the information provided in the text, it is likely that the accusations made by Russia were not accepted by the Czech government, and therefore the veracity of the text is TRUE.

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

The Czech government actually rejected the Russian accusation, as Brabec claims, and the Russian ambassador was indeed invited to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. We assess the statement as true despite Brabec's inaccuracy that Minister Stropnický himself negotiated with the Russian ambassador. In reality, it was his deputy Šrámek.

The government opposed the Russian accusation in a statement issued after Prime Minister Babiš's meeting with the directors of the BIS and Military Intelligence. It states, among other things, that:

"No Novichok-type substance has ever been produced, developed or stored in the Czech Republic. This was stated unanimously by both intelligence services in their reports. In the Czech Republic, a program for the protection of troops and the population and the detection of weapons of mass destruction was launched in 2017. As part of this program, the Novichok A-230 substance was to be tested.

In the first phase, the microsynthesis of the substance Novichok A-230 was carried out. During the microsynthesis, the substance was not isolated and this procedure is not considered production or development according to the methodology of the State Office for Nuclear Safety. The resulting product was immediately destroyed. The second phase of the program was not started. The substance of the Novichok A-230 type is different from the substance A-234, which was used in the poisoning of Sergei Skripal in the United Kingdom. The two substances are completely different and have a clearly different chemical structure.

Subsequently, as Brabec claims, the Russian ambassador was indeed invited. The Russian ambassador was informed of the Czech Republic's reservations regarding Russia's accusation of producing Novichok (video from 4:57). However, the meeting with the Russian ambassador was not attended by Minister Stropnický, but by his deputy Šrámek (video from 00:10).

SUMMARY: The answer is TRUE because the text states that the solution was agreed upon

demagog-statements-public/statement_only.question:
Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

At the outset, it should be clarified that Chairman Fiala is talking about Act No. 236/1995 Coll. (abbreviated as the salary of constitutional officials). The so-called automaton , or linking the salary of constitutional officials to the state of the economy, is reflected in the determination of a certain coefficient by which the so-called salary base is multiplied. This is 2.75 times the " average nominal monthly salary of natural persons in the non-business sphere achieved according to published data from the Czech Statistical Office for the calendar year before last " . In other words, for 2019, the salary base is calculated as 2.75 times the average monthly salary for 2017 and determined by the communication of the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs.

The above-described machine itself was already part of Act No. 309/2002 Coll., on amendments to laws related to the adoption of the Act on the Service of Civil Servants in Administrative Offices. At that time, the salary base for representatives designated by the Act was to be three times the average monthly wage for the year before last. The purpose of this establishment was actually to establish a " stable link between the salaries of constitutional officials and the development of wages in the non-business sphere " (.doc, p. 36). The procedural history of this provision then consisted primarily in the several postponements of the effectiveness of this act or the annulment of individual provisions of the Act on the Salary of Constitutional Officials by the Constitutional Court. The final amendment to Act No. 359/2014 Coll. from 2014 comes (.pdf) from the pen of Jan Hamáček, the then Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies. The original government proposal (Bohuslav Sobotka's government) envisaged (.pdf) a fixed salary of CZK 52,248 for the next four years, and in the end, Hamáček's amendment was accepted instead.

The new salary range was thus determined by determining a new multiple for deputies (2.75) and a special multiple for judges (3.00). Given the difference between the fixed amount for 2014 and the amount given by the multiple in 2015, Hamáček's proposal provided for a gradual annual increase in the multiple over four years. The salary base should thus reach 2.5 times the average wage for the year before last in 2018.

Petr Fiala and the entire ODS did not vote for either Hamáček's amendment or the final wording of the law . The majority abstained, and in the second vote two deputies were against. Therefore, the expression " we agreed " used by Chairman Fiala in his statement is somewhat questionable.

As for the meaning of the statement about " creating a solution that we will not have to return to ", the amendment may directly imply an effort after 2018 (when the salary was calculated by a multiple of 2.5) to immediately jump to calculating with a multiple of 2.75 in the following year. According to data from Czech Television (infobox note), however, such a procedure would cause the salary of a deputy and senator to increase by 14,700 CZK. The government, which proposed an amendment to the Act on the Salaries of Constitutional Officials, is probably aware of this. It should (.pdf, p. 3) permanently reduce the multiple for the calculation back to 2.5 and also change the average that will be multiplied.

It was also the ODS's votes that moved the proposal from the first reading to committees, which means that the Chamber of Deputies, including the ODS, will consider this proposal and will return to addressing the salaries of MPs, thanks to the ODS.

To summarize the assessment, the timing of the adoption of the amendment is appropriate, but the intention not to return to discussing salaries does not follow from the ODS's vote so far, which concerns the new government draft amendment (the discussion took place on November 15, 2018).
